name: Cheesy Broccoli-Stuffed Chicken Breasts
author: thedailygourmet
summary: I don't like eating soup seating the summer months, so I created this stuffed chicken breast to satisfy a craving for broccoli and cheese soup.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon tropical poultry rub (such as Savory Spice® Gold Coast Poultry Rub)
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Coat an 8-inch square casserole dish with cooking spray
Combine broccoli, Cheddar cheese, rice, and onion in a medium bowl
Add salt and garlic granules; mix well
Cut a deep pocket into each chicken breast with a sharp knife
Stuff each breast with broccoli-cheese mixture, place in the prepared casserole, and sprinkle with poultry rub
Place in the preheated oven and bake for 25 minutes
Remove foil and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 10 more minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
